result.execSummary:
The defendant William Wesley Arndt-Carmody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete all assessments and treatment programs as recommended by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA costs.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Wesley Arndt-Carmody in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution. Information filed (amend for three counts of 943.20(1)(a) and plea agreement recited. Formal reading waived. Colloquy. NC pleas entered. Factual basis found, accepts NC pleas, finding of guilt. Comment by Atty Edwards. 

Sentencing: 

Ct 1: Sentence withheld for 2 years probation. Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete all assessments and treatment programs as recommended by agent, pay costs of the action and costs of probation, DNA sample & surcharge. 

Ct. 2: Sentence withheld for 2 years probation. Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete all assessments and treatment programs as recommended by agent. Costs remitted on this count.

Ct. 3: Sentence withheld for 2 years probation. Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete all assessments and treatment programs as recommended by agent. Costs remitted on this count.

Defendant William Wesley Arndt-Carmody in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Edwards inform the Court that the Def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court receives waiver doc and conducts waiver colloquy.  Court accepts def's waiver of right to prelim and binds def over on the felony charge.  Arraignment set for 7/5 at 3:30.  Arraignment scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William Wesley Arndt-Carmody in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. E asks for continued date; states she has received discovery.  Matter adj. to June 22 at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant William Wesley Arndt-Carmody in court with attorney Suzanne Edwards. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. E waives formal reading of the complaint as well as the time limits for holding the prelim; requests status.  Court states charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Next date set as AIA as reminder prelim not yet been held or waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Clerk notes, at 3:00 p.m., that this case was filed this morning downstairs, unbeknowns to DA's staff and COC staff that, upstairs in court, the DA had motioned for def's release from bond on indication that summons and complaint would be coming.  As such, there is no bond.  DA states that the initial appearance will be set for 1/20 with exact date/time communicated to COC office by DA.
